column4: Hello my dear helpers! I can't seem to be able to use my external disk to be writable in ubuntu. I think its the Usb-S-ATA bridge linux doesnt like. WIndows hates it too. What to do?
Hello my dear helpers! I can't seem to be able to use my external disk to be writable in ubuntu. I think its the Usb-S-ATA bridge linux doesnt like. WIndows hates it too. What to do?
not even when root. I'd gksudo nautilus access the external disk and it still wouldn't boot.
